content: turn to the right side you should have 10 10 12 14 14 16 stitches remaining move on to the gusset section gusset for the gusset you will be picking up stitches along both sides of the heel flap there are many different methods for picking up gusset stitches some people like to pick up only the front or back loop others pick up both loops the important thing is to pick a method and stay with it consistently for all of the picked up stitches i like to use two needles and pick up and knit the stitches as i go knit across heel stitches then pick up and knit 8 9 10 11 12 13 stitches along the edge of the heel flap pick up and knit one more stitch at the corner between the heel flap and instep this will help prevent a hole at the corner there should now be 19 20 23 26 27 30 stitches on this needle knit across the 16 18 20 22 24 26 instep stitches now either using the remain dpns or arranging the stitches in three groupings on the circular needle pick up one stitch in the corner and 8 9 10 11 12 13 stitches along the edge of the heel flap if you are using dpns knit the first half of the heel 5 5 6 7 7 8 stitches onto the same needle as the stitches that you just picked up then knit across the rest of the heel stitches on the next needle the two heel needles should now each have 14 15 17 19 20 22 stitches if you are using the magic loop method knit across the rest of the heel stitches you should have a total of 28 30 34 38 40 44 heel/gusset stitches gusset decreases start the round at the beginning of the instep stitches round one- k across the 16 18 20 22 24 26 instep stitches k1 ssk k to last 3 stitches k2tog k1 round two- k all stitches repeat these two rounds until you are back to a total of 32 36 40 44 48 52 stitches move on to the foot rose city rollers le orangeknitsdesigns 3 foot continue knitting st st in the round until the foot of the sock measures about 1-1½ inches shorter than the foot length measurement depending on the sock size you are knitting because the baby sizes have less stitches the toe will be shorter if you are able to try the sock on it should reach the base of the pinkie toe move on to the toe toe i have only included a square toe for this pattern because i think it works better for tiny toes if you prefer a rounder toe you can use the round toe instructions from the original rose city rollers pattern round one- k1
